column4: Hi, I've just installed Ubuntu 11.04, and my firefox crashes for about everything (even with flash uninstalled). libflashplayer.so an libfontconfig.so appear on the reports
@Frank I'm having the same problems with Firefox (even with Chromium)
Frank_: did you run all the updates?  bounce the box when it asked to?
yes, I've run every updates available.
Most IRC clients will auto-highlight lines that start with your nick.
Sadly no.  I've had problems due to firefox before, but not the one you're experiencing. You say it's dying every time you launch firefox, or just when you open a page with flash?
it launches ok, but crash on random pages, not only the ones with flash. It even crashed at google!
Umm.  Is the box otherwise stable?
I think so. I've struggled installing both Nvidia and PCI Wifi drivers. Could that be the problem? A buggy driver?
I suppose it could be, but wouldn't jump to that quite yet...
Did you make any alterations, like say, turning off swap?
mmm, no. But I've installed my custom partitioning set ( 3 partitions: / , /home, swap )
K.  Make sure swap is indeed being used.
: how can I check my swap?
look in /proc/swaps or /proc/meminfo.  Or even just run top
: my swap (8gb) is not being used, but I guess is because I've installed 4gb ram
K.  But it's there, which is important.
Did you try blowing away (or just moving to a new name) your ~/.mozilla directory ?
